conclusion: Beam b corresponds to the color with the higher refractive index in the glass, the shorter-wavelength/“bluer” light.
Inside the prism both beams hit the same glass–air interface at the same internal angle θ.
Total internal reflection occurs when θ ≥ θc, where θc = arcsin(1 / n) and n is the refractive index of the glass for the particular wavelength.
Visible light is dispersive in glass: nblue > nred.
θc,blue = arcsin(1/nblue) is smaller than θc,red.
As θ is gradually increased from some common starting value, the beam whose critical angle is the smaller (the one with the larger n) will reach the condition θ = θc first.
Therefore the higher-index (bluer) beam – labelled b in the problem – undergoes total internal reflection before beam a.
